metadata.feature_description: Configure text editor type (Plain Text or Rich WYSIWYG) for content creation in Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events modules.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Answers module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Navigate to Community Settings and locate Enable WYSIWYG section
steps.expected: Enable WYSIWYG section visible with Answers checkbox checked
steps.actual: Enable WYSIWYG section displayed with all four module checkboxes visible, Answers initially checked

steps.action: Click on Answers checkbox to uncheck it
steps.expected: Answers checkbox becomes unchecked (Plain Text editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Answers module to Rich editor

steps.action: Click on Answers checkbox to check it
steps.expected: Answers checkbox becomes checked (Rich WYSIWYG editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Discussions module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Click on Discussions checkbox to uncheck it
steps.expected: Discussions checkbox becomes unchecked (Plain Text editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Discussions module to Rich editor

steps.action: Click on Discussions checkbox to check it
steps.expected: Discussions checkbox becomes checked (Rich WYSIWYG editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Ideas module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Click on Ideas checkbox to uncheck it
steps.expected: Ideas checkbox becomes unchecked (Plain Text editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Ideas module to Rich editor

steps.action: Click on Ideas checkbox to check it
steps.expected: Ideas checkbox becomes checked (Rich WYSIWYG editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Social Events module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Click on Social Events checkbox to uncheck it
steps.expected: Social Events checkbox becomes unchecked (Plain Text editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Social Events module to Rich editor

steps.action: Click on Social Events checkbox to check it
steps.expected: Social Events checkbox becomes checked (Rich WYSIWYG editor mode)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save all editor settings and verify persistence

steps.action: Uncheck Answers in Enable WYSIWYG section and click Save button
steps.expected: Settings saved successfully with success notification
steps.actual: Success notification 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming save operation

steps.action: Navigate away from Community Settings and return to verify persistence
steps.expected: Answers checkbox should remain unchecked after returning to Community Settings
steps.actual: Answers checkbox was reverted to checked state after navigation, settings did not persist

issues: Editor Choice Configuration settings appear to save (success notification shown) but do not persist after navigating away from the Community Settings panel. Upon returning to the Community Settings, all checkboxes revert to their default checked state.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify default values (all Rich/1) for new installations

steps.action: Observe the initial state of Enable WYSIWYG checkboxes when first accessing Community Settings
steps.expected: All four checkboxes (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events) should be checked by default (Rich editor mode)
steps.actual: All four checkboxes were checked by default, indicating Rich WYSIWYG editor is the default for all modules

observations: The Enable WYSIWYG section is part of the Miscellaneous Community Settings area within the Community Settings panel
The UI successfully allows toggling between Plain Text (unchecked) and Rich WYSIWYG (checked) editor modes for all four modules
Save operation shows success notification but settings do not persist across panel navigation - this may be a bug in the settings persistence mechanism
All default values are set to Rich editor (checked) which aligns with the expected defaults per the feature specification
